document.masterDocTitle: Revision of Hoplasoma (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Galerucinae) of the Philippines, with descriptions of five new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of Hoplasoma (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Galerucinae) of the Philippines, with descriptions of five new species

heading.emphasis:
Key to species of
Hoplasoma
of the Philippines

paragraph.keyLead: 1 . Males. Abdomen with a pair of processes from the posterior margin of the second ventrite and the last ventrite with a well defined smooth subquadrate area......................................................................... 2
- Females. Abdomen without processes and the last ventrite without the subquadrate area............................ 9

3 . Abdomen yellowish brown. Processes long, reaching beyond base of ventrite 4 , broad-based and divergent distally. Median lobe of aedeagus short and broad, 4.50 -7.00 times as long as wide (measured across middle) ( Figs 19, 22 ). Mindanao, Mindoro.................................................................................................... 4

- Abdomen black or mostly black. Processes short, reaching base of ventrite 4 , triangular and subparallel. Median lobe of aedeagus long and narrow, 10.00 times as long as wide (measured across middle) (
Fig. 23
). Luzon...
H. philippinense Jacoby

- Abdominal processes long, reaching base of ventrite 5 (
Fig. 11
). Median lobe of aedeagus symmetrical (
Fig. 19
). Mindoro....................................................................................
H. konstantinovi
sp. nov.

- Distance between the bases of abdominal appendages shorter than the length of appendage. Median lobe of aedeagus subapically not extended or distinctly widended............................................................ 6

6 . Abdominal appendages triangular (
Fig. 13
). In dorsal view, median lobe of aedeagus wide basally, distinctly narrowed towards apex, slightly narrowed in the middle (
Fig. 21
).............................................
H. mcgregori
sp. nov.

7 . Abdominal appendages elongate triangular (
Fig. 17
). Subapical part of median lobe of aedeagus strongly widened (
Fig. 25
)........................................................................................
H. semperi
sp. nov.

- Abdominal appendages parallel-sided. Subapical part of median lobe of aedeagus not or only slightly widened ( Figs. 18, 20 )..................................................................................................... 8

8 . Abdominal appendages very thin, 5.3 times as long as wide (
Fig. 12
). Subapical part of median lobe of aedeagus slightly widended (
Fig. 20
). Mindanao, Sulu, Samar and Panaon......................................
H. magellani
sp. nov.

- Abdominal appendages slightly wider, 4.5 times as long as wide (
Fig. 10
). Median lobe of aedeagus almost parallel-sided, apex widely rounded (
Fig. 18
). Sibuyan......................................................
H. bakeri
sp. nov.

10 . Last ventrite narrower, twice as broad as long, apical convexity forms broad, simple obtuse angle (
Fig. 30
). Mindanao.....................................................................................
H. mindanense Medvedev

- Last ventrite broader, 2.20 times as broad as long, apical margin medially convex with concavity on either side (
Fig. 27
). Mindoro.........................................................................
H. konstantinovi
sp. nov.
11 . Apex of the last ventrite rounded or with blunt lobe.......................................................... 12
- Apex of the last ventrite with sharp triangular process....................................................... 14

12 . Apex of the last ventrite strongly convex (
Fig. 31
)..........................................
H. philippinense Jacoby
- Last ventrite with blunt lobe at middle third ( Figs. 28, 32 )................................................... 13

13 . Blunt lobe at apex of last ventrite shorter, strongly transverse, with slightly convex apex (
Fig. 28
). Mindanao, Sulu, Samar and Panaon.............................................................................
H. magellani
sp. nov.

- Blunt lobe at apex of last ventrite longer, only slightly transverse, with distinctly truncate apex (
Fig. 32
). Luzon...............................................................................................
H. picifemora Allard

14 . Apical process of last ventrite narrowly acute (< 45 °), with deeply concave sides (
Fig. 26
). Sibuyan......
H. bakeri
sp. nov.

- Apical process of last ventrite almost right-angled, with less concave sides (
Fig. 29
). Negros.........
H. mcgregori
sp. nov.
